definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: His handwritten poems are worth a fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他手寫的詩稿價值不菲。

sentences.english: He contributed poems to the magazine.
He contributed poem to a newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他向報社投了一篇詩稿。

sentences.english: Some grandpas poem draft, pass by didn't also what use, all was to wipe Mao paper.
sentences.chinese: 有些爺爺的詩稿，過去也沒啥用，都當了揩腚紙。

sentences.english: He stood agape, the manuscript clutched in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他目瞪口呆地站着，手裏緊握着那沓詩稿。

sentences.english: Finally he slowly slid the cap on to his fountain pen and put away his manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 他終於把鋼筆慢慢地插入筆帽，藏起了自己的詩稿。

definition: to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
(literary) to end/to stop/one of the stanzas (usually two) of a ci poem 詞|词[ci2]/classifier for songs or ci poems
words written on one’s deathbed/an artist's final work/swansong
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
postal kiosk/(old) rest shelter for couriers
old anecdote/stories passed on from former times
